title: leasehold homes cma investigation fees terms housing
story: IM Subscribe &nbsp registerIM SubscribeCreated with Sketch.IM Join us? Subscribe &nbsp registerIM Join us? SubscribeJoin us? Subscribe  registerJoin us? SubscribeLog in using your social network accountLog in directly with The IndependentKeep me logged inForgotten your password?Try Independent Minds free for 1 monthSee the optionsCompetition and Markets Authority probes excessive fees, onerous contracts and&nbsprip-off property sales&nbspClick to followThe IndependentThe CMA plans to use consumer protection laws rather than use its powers to conduct a full ‘market study’The competition watchdog is to investigate sales of leasehold homes as concerns grow that thousands of buyers have been locked into paying extortionate charges that they did not understand when they bought their property.The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) is opening a probe into unfair terms, excessive fees and inadequate information given to some buyers of new properties.Consumer groups have warned for more than two years that leasehold property buyers have been ripped off on a large scale, comparing the scandal to the mis-selling of payment protection insurance (PPI) and endowment mortgages which resulted in billions of pounds of compensation.In the worst cases,&nbspleaseholders have been left trapped in unsellable and unmortgageable homes, prompting calls for an overhaul of the market.In a letter to the Housing, Communities and Local Government committee (HCLG), CMA chief executive Andrea Coscelli said the watchdog acknowledges the problems around leasehold sales.Created with Sketch. Show all 13Created with Sketch.Created with Sketch.Created with Sketch.Looking out of the lobby of Trump TowerA view of the atrium of Trump TowerTrump tower from across Fifth AvenueA view of the atrium inside Trump TowerA counter selling Trump merchandise including his 1987 book The Art of the DealThe waterfall in the atrium of Trump TowerThe atrium of Trump Tower featuring a Starbucks outletA doorman stands by the lobby elevator in Trump TowerDonald Trump merchandise for sale in a gift shop of Trump TowerTrump merchandise on display by the entrance to a bar named after Trump in Trump TowerShoppers and diners in the atrium of Trump TowerA view up Trump TowerLooking out of the lobby of Trump TowerA view of the atrium of Trump TowerTrump tower from across Fifth AvenueA view of the atrium inside Trump TowerA counter selling Trump merchandise including his 1987 book The Art of the DealThe waterfall in the atrium of Trump TowerThe atrium of Trump Tower featuring a Starbucks outletA doorman stands by the lobby elevator in Trump TowerDonald Trump merchandise for sale in a gift shop of Trump TowerTrump merchandise on display by the entrance to a bar named after Trump in Trump TowerShoppers and diners in the atrium of Trump TowerA view up Trump TowerThe CMA plans to use consumer protection laws rather than use its powers to conduct a full “market study”.Eventually, this may lead to action being taken against firms who have ripped customers off.Leaseholders are granted the right to live in their property for an agreed period – usually between 99 and 125 years.&nbspUnder the lease,&nbspthe freeholder typically charges ground rent to the leaseholder. Charges can also be levied for making alterations to a property. A significant number of leaseholders say they have been hit with unjustifiable rises to the ground rent or unfair charges for making minor cosmetic changes such as changing a doorbell.In the most extreme cases, fees have been so high properties become difficult to sell.Half of leasehold house owners didn’t know what they were buyingThe HCLG&nbspcommittee is concerned that some leaseholds have been quickly sold on to third parties who then vastly increase the cost.Committee chair&nbspClive Betts said: “We heard extensive evidence from leaseholders regarding onerous ground rent terms, high and opaque service charges and one-off bills, unfair and excessive permission charges, and unreasonable costs to enfranchise or extend leases.“Over the course of the inquiry we heard evidence suggesting that there are a significant number of cases where home buyers may have been deliberately misled about the terms they were signing up to.“If the sale of leasehold house has taken place with the home buyer under the impression that they were buying it freehold, or ‘equivalent to freehold’ as many were told, then action needs to be taken.“Equally, if a home buyer is told they will be able to buy the freehold in a couple of years, only to find out it has been sold on to another company, then this should be investigated.”He continued: “Home buyers need to be protected and, where evidence of mis-selling is proved, it is right that the CMA take action.”A CMA spokesperson&nbspsaid: “The select committee has raised serious concerns that many homeowners who buy long leasehold property don’t know exactly what they are signing up to, and may be trapped in contracts with unfair terms once they move in.“We have committed to investigating whether these homeowners are being hit with expensive fees or unfair contract terms, as well as being given all the information they need before signing on the dotted line. We will set out the full terms of this work when it begins.”More than 40 property developers and freeholders have signed up to a pledge launched by communities secretary James Brokenshire to prevent leaseholders being trapped in costly deals.Mr Brokenshire said: “For too long, exploitative and unfair leasehold arrangements have placed excessive burdens on homeowners.“These have no place in a modern housing market and since becoming communities secretary I have repeatedly made clear my ambition to end them.“That’s why I asked the Competition and Markets Authority to look into the issue and I am pleased to see it is now taking action.”Only the best news in your inboxOnly the best news in your inboxEnter your email addressFill out this fieldEmail already exists. instantly recognisable to fans of the classic flip phoneClick to followThe Independent TechFifteen years after the launch of the Motorola Razr, the iconic flip phone is about to get a 2019 makeover.A new video of the folding phone has been shared on the Weibo page of Motorola’s parent company Lenovo, revealing a render of what the new device might look like.The phone will be&nbspinstantly recognisable to fans of the original, featuring the same slim design and folding mechanism.Beyond the technological upgrades, the main difference appears to be that the new phone is noticeably wider Those in attendance&nbspon the French Riviera gave the film&nbspa standing ovation, yet the reviews have been lukewarm.&nbspDirected by Dexter Fletcher and starring Taron Egerton, Rocketman has been called a fantastical account of the “Tiny Dancer” singer’s life,&nbsprather than a warts-and-all telling.Many critics compared the film to&nbspQueen biopic Bohemian Rhapsody, which was worked on by Dexter Fletcher, who took over as director from Brian Singer midway through production. Bohemian Rhapsody defied middling reviews to gross upwards of&nbsp£705 million at the global box office.The Independent‘s&nbspGeoffrey Macnab&nbspsaid Fletcher “uses lavish musical sequences to whisk his way through episodes in Elton John’s life”. Macnab describes the film as ing into some of Elton’s darkest moments, but that&nbspthese are filmed in a&nbsp”very flamboyant fashion” that&nbsp”manages to leaven matters with some ironic humour”.Created with Sketch. SubscribeLog in using your social network accountLog in directly with The IndependentKeep me logged inForgotten your password?Try Independent Minds free for 1 monthSee the optionsThe flower moon follows a blood moon, a pink moon and a super worm moon in this year's lunar eventsClick to followThe IndependentAs the saying suggests, a blue moon is a rare event. This weekend’s full flower blue moon is even rarer still, happening only every dozen or so blue moons.But despite what its name suggests, this full moon is not actually blue. The name simply refers to the fact that it is the fourth full moon of the season, when typically there are only three full moons in a season.In 2019 there has already been a blood moon, a pink moon and a super worm moon –&nbspeach named (in these cases) after its colour or&nbspoccurrences that take place at the time of year the full moon appears (a “worm” moon is named thus as it comes at time small creatures – such as worms – emerge from the ground, signifying the end of winter).The flower moon, which is set to rise at dusk on Saturday 18 May, is appropriately named after the flowers that bloom in the month of May.The next blue moon won’t occur again until 2021, so astronomers will be hoping for clear skies this weekend.Created with Sketch.Super worm moon - title: tyler the creator igor stream tracklist features credits kanye playboi carti
story: IM Subscribe &nbsp registerIM SubscribeCreated with Sketch.IM Join us? Subscribe &nbsp registerIM Join us? SubscribeJoin us? Subscribe  registerJoin us? SubscribeLog in using your social network accountLog in directly with The IndependentKeep me logged inForgotten your password?Try Independent Minds free for 1 monthSee the optionsAlbum includes a track that nods to Call Me By Your NameClick to followThe Independent CultureTyler, the Creator attends the 60th Annual Grammy AwardsTyler, the Creator has released his anticipated new album IGOR.The record serves as the follow-up to his acclaimed 2017 LP Flower Boy, and includes credits for Kanye West, Lil Uzi Vert, Al Green, Playboi Carti and Cullen Omori (formerly of Smith Westerns) as co-writers.&nbspWest is not credited as a featured artist but can be heard on the track “Puppet”.&nbspCreated with Sketch.The best albums of 2019 (so far) Show all 32Created with Sketch.Created with Sketch.Created with Sketch.It’s not uncommon for an artist to be influenced by the place they grew up in. Yet few are likely to have as much inspiration to draw on as India-born, Zimbabwe-raised and now Peckham-based artist Rina Mushonga.On Deerhunter’s eighth album, frontman Bradford Cox takes on the role of war poet, documenting the things he observes with a cool matter-of-factness, and heart-wrenching detail. Death is everywhere on Why Hasn’t Everything Already Disappeared?, as much as others may refuse to see it.After a period of tumult, Sharon Van Etten’s fifth album is a reinvention. But beneath its hazy synths and electronics are songs of endurance and inner peace, of settling after a flurry of activity. 432 Bring Me the Horizon  – AmoBMTH frontman Oli Sykes wants to assert the fragility of the boundary between love and hate. Amo is a way of exploring that, even down to the title itself.532 Nina Nesbitt – The Sun Will Come Up, the Seasons Will ChangeNesbitt is back with her second LP, switching to a brand of soul and R&ampB-fused pop that feels bang on time, and suits her far better. The Sun Will Come Up, the Seasons Will Change has slick, polished production from Fraser T Smith (Adele), Lostboy (Anne-Marie), Jordan Riley (Zara Larsson), and Nesbitt herself.This self-titled record, a loose but beautifully crafted collection of folk-rock songs, explores the kinds of anxieties intrinsic to the modern age – the longing to be at once noticed and invisible the paralysing effects of limitless information, and the desire to do good versus the desire to be seen doing good.The album is packed with personal confessions for the fans – “Arianators” – to pick over. It lacks a centrepiece to match the arresting depth and space of Sweetener’s “God Is A Woman”, but Grande handles its shifting moods and cast of producers (including pop machines Max Martin and Tommy Brown) with engaging class and momentum. One minute you’re skanking along to the party brass of “Bloodline” the next floating into the semi-detached, heartbreak of “Ghostin’”, which appears to address Grande’s guilt at being with Davidson while pining for Miller. She sings of the late rapper as a “wingless angel” with featherlight high notes that will drop the sternest jaw. (Helen Brown)The perma-brilliant James Blake has flooded his fourth album – Assume Form – with euphoric sepia soul and loved-up doo-wop. His trademark intelligence, honesty and pin-drop production remain intact. But the detached chorister vocals of a decade in which he battled depression have thawed to reveal a millennial Sam Cooke crooning: “Can’t believe the way we flow, way we flow, way we flow...”While he recognises his roots and includes plenty of nods to grime, AJ Tracey's magpie’s eye for a good melody or hook extends far beyond that. With the help of stellar producers like Cadenza (Kiko Bun), Swifta Beater (Kano, Giggs), and Nyge (Section Boyz, Yxng Bane), Tracey incorporates electronic music, rock, garage and even country on his most cohesive work to date.The album title of the year gives us an image of Brexit Britain trashed by Old Etonians David Cameron, Boris Johnson and Jacob Rees-Mogg, but the fifth studio work from the punk duo has more than social commentary to offer. There’s some of that, as vocalist Jason Williamson skewers documentary-makers who take advantage of the poor in “Kebab Spider” – “the skint get used in loo roll shoes” – but elsewhere this is a record that expands the idea of what Sleaford Mods could be.“Do you still have that photograph? Would you use it to hurt me?” asks Australian indie rocker Julia Jacklin, against the menacing throb of “Body”. The tension is stormy: imagine a mid-period Fleetwood Mac song, covered by Cat Power. For a start, the range of guest performers is a cornucopia of contemporary soul and hip-hop collaborators: vocalists Moses Sumney, Roots Manuva, Heidi Vogel, Grey Reverend and Tawiah strings player Miguel Atwood-Ferguson, and keyboardist Dennis Hamm – both of whom have worked with Flying Lotus and Thundercat.Rose – who found fame in the UK’s indie-folk scene as an unofficial member of Bombay Bicycle Club in 2010, only to walk away amid the band’s growing hype – is darkly compelling on No Words Left. Assisted by producer Tim Bidwell, who worked on Rose’s last record Something’s Changing, she sounds braver than she ever has before. There are moments that recall her Communion labelmate Ben Howard, on his latest album, Noonday Dream, and others that nod to the quiet stoicism of Joni Mitchell and Neil Young. (Roisin O'Connor)The record is loosely conceptual insomuch as it’s punctuated with mock adverts for “WWAY HEALTH, our 247 care programme”. Yanya – who is of Turkish-Irish-Bajan heritage – grew up in London on a mix of Pixies, Nina Simone, The Libertines and Amy Winehouse, and this unlikely combination is certainly reflected in the sound. (Patrick Smith)2132 Jenny Lewis – On the LineHere, Lewis does what she does best: adds the glossy sparkle of Hollywood and a sunny Californian sheen to melancholy and nostalgia, with her most luxuriantly orchestrated album yet. It’s a bittersweet mourning of her past. (Elisa Bray)Comprising songs from Segall’s eclectic (that’s putting it lightly) catalogue and performed by him and the Freedom Band (Mikal Cronin, Charles Moothart, Emmett Kelly, and Ben Boye), the album is delightfully short and sweet. It is, she says, “The Kinks meet the Second World War, or Bob Seger meets Enya.”Tension aside, there’s a great sense of fun here. The title track is pure euphoria, as restless synths of a Utah Saints or Orbital rave break into swelling bass and melody. It’s masterful production. (Elisa Bray)Six months after the release of Oxnard, Anderson .Paak returns with another Dr Dre-produced record, Ventura. She cited&nbsplyrics from his first&nbspmixtape, Bastard,&nbspreleased in 2009, as the reason for the ban.“Coming to the UK is a privilege,” a&nbspletter from the government said at the time, “and we expect those who come here to respect our shared values”.The ban – which led to Tyler cancelling a show at Reading and Leeds festival – was&nbspreportedly&nbsplifted earlier this year, on the 13&nbspFebruary. It is understood that the rapper arrived at Luton Airport in the early hours of the morning (18 May).Tyler posted a picture of himself standing outside Buckingham Palace on Twitter and&nbspteased a secret show later in the day, with the photograph's caption reading: “LONDON IGOR 3PM WILL UPDATE YOU LATER WITH LOCATION.”Tyler later revealed&nbspthat the show was due to&nbsptake place at&nbspBussey building in Peckham&nbspat 3pm. perfect stitches Not the type of jumper that makes you itches.”1440 The Smiths – There is a Light that Never Goes Out“Take me out tonightTake me anywhere, I don't careI don't care, I don't care.”1540 threw away our apple seed.”1740 Public Enemy – Black Steel in the Hour of Chaos“I got a letter from the government The other dayI opened and read itIt said they were suckers They wanted me for their army or whatever Picture me given' a damn, I said never.”“First you get a swimming pool full of liquor, then you e in it Pool full of liquor, then you e in it I wave a few bottles, then I watch 'em all flock”.Getty Images for NARAS1940 Prince – Sign O' the Times“A skinny man died of a big disease with a little name By chance his girlfriend came across a needle and soon she did the same.”War, children, it's just a shot away It's just a shot away.2140 David Bowie – Station to Station“Once there were mountains on mountains And once there were sun birds to soar with And once I could never be downGot to keep searching and searching.”“She done it with a doctor on a helicopter She's sniffin in her tissue Sellin' the Big Issue.”“You had chemicals boy I've grown so close to you Boy and you just groan boy.”And I saw my reflection in the snow-covered hills Till the landslide brought me down“She comes back to tell me she's gone As if I didn't know that As if I didn't know my own bed.” 2640 I washed your dishes, but I shit in your bathroom.”“Jesus died for somebody's sins but not mine Meltin’ in a pot of thieves Wild card up my sleeve Thick heart of stone My sins my own They belong to me”“There she stood in the doorway I heard the mission bell And I was thinking to myself This could be Heaven or this could be Hell.”3040 Thin Lizzy – The Boys are Back in Town“Guess who just got back today Them wild-eyed boys that had been away Haven't changed that much to sayBut man, I still think them cats are crazy.”I’ll kill the first mother I see My life has been too rough I’m awfully bitter these days Because my parents were slaves.“Digital witnesses what’s the point of even sleeping? He aims to sell himself as an effective leader who is open to compromise and evidences this with his experience as governorOhio representative Tim Ryan will be running a campaign that hinges on his working class rootsThe campaign said the release of Mr Sanders' Thurgood Marshall Plan for Public Education and Educators was timed to coincide with the 65th anniversary of the Brown v Board of Education ruling that racial segregation in public schools was unconstitutional.As the head of the NAACP Legal Defence and Educational Fund, Marshall served as chief attorney for the plaintiffs, more than a decade before becoming the first black US Supreme Court justice.To combat disparities in education funding, the senator from Vermont is proposing large new investments in programmes that serve high-poverty communities, support special needs students, and augment local efforts to integrate school districts.Bernie Sanders and AOC propose credit card interest rate capsThat also includes a minimum on per-pupil spending in all school districts across the country, as well as a universal school meal plan and a goal of closing the gap in school infrastructure funding to renovate, modernise, and green the nation's schools.Mr Sanders' plan also proposes investment to raise starting teacher salaries to at least $60,000 (£47,000), as well as grants and tax credits to help teachers defray the cost of school supplies.This is Mr Sanders' first major plan of this campaign for K-12 education reforms. Dating back to his 2016 run for president, Mr Sanders has repeatedly addressed reforms in higher education, including making four-year college free.Some of the other nearly two-dozen candidates seeking the Democratic presidential nomination have come out with their own plans for elementary and higher education.Earlier this year, senator Kamala Harris of California made her first campaign policy rollout a federal investment in teacher pay.Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts has proposed alleviating almost all college debt for 42 million Americans, proposing an ultra-millionaire tax to fund the $640bn cost.Earlier this week, Ms Warren said her secretary of education will be a former public school teacher who is committed to public education.Only the best news in your inboxOnly the best news in your inboxEnter your email addressFill out this fieldEmail already exists. title: labour shadow brexit secretary keir starmer pockets 125000 from law firm derailing britains eu exit
story: Former Director of Public Prosecutions Starmer - who was also involved with a failed witchhunt of Sun journalists – has revealed he was paid up to £ an hour by Mishcon de Reya.Mishcon was one of three law firms that brought the legal challenge to Theresa May’s Brexit plans in the High Court this week.Starmer, , was elected as a Labour MP for Holborn and St Pancras in May last year – a role which pays £,.Between June and the end of September this year he was paid £, by Mishcon de Reya for  hours of “legal advice” - a rate of £ per hour.Late last year he earned £, offering legal advice to the law firm for  hours – or £ an hour.He also revealed a payment of £, on May , , for work carried out before he became an MP.He lives in a £million house in North London with solicitor we Victoria, , and their two young children. He also co-owns a house in Surrey.Mishcon de Reya first hired him in  as a part-time consultant for its business crime unit.He quit client work for the firm in April , but was reappointed as a consultant to its in-house academy in June this year.The MP stood down from that role after being appointed to the shadow cabinet last month.Starmer is the third key figure from the lacklustre £.m Operation Elveden witchhunt of Sun reporters to be employed by Mishcon de Reya.His former principal legal adviser at the Crown Prosecution Service Alison Levitt and former politan police assistant commissioner Sue Akers – who headed the bungled investigation – have also done work for the firm.This week Starmer refused to apologise after reporter Anthony France had his conviction overturned - meaning not one of  Sun journalists arrested were convicted.A spokeswoman for the law firm said: “Keir Starmer was a consultant to the Mishcon Academy, our in-house centre for learning and development.“The role did not involve client advice on any issue. Keir resigned as a consultant to the academy when he was appointed to the Shadow Cabinet.”A spokesman for Starmer’s office said: “MPs are required to register and declare fees received since the May  election even where those fees were earned before the election.“The register makes it very clear that in the case of Keir Starmer, the vast majority of his declared earnings represent payment for work undertaken by him as a lawyer before he became MP.”Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: european elections uk candidates brexit party
story: But who are the candidates and which parties have launched their campaign  Here’s what we know.Seats in England, Scotland and Wales are given to parties based on their share of the vote for candidates on lists created by the parties.In Northern Ireland, the country elects MEPs using a single transferable vote system where voters are able to rank candidates by preference.The Labour Party, Liberal Democrats, the Brexit Party and Ukip have all selected  candidates across the  regions.The Conservative Party has  candidates standing.Change UK originally selected , but two have stepped down over controversy surrounding their social media posts.The Green Party has  candidates standing in England and Wales and has six candidates for the Scottish Greens.Leaders of the SDLP, the Alliance Party, TUV as well as Sinn Fein’s Martina Anderson, DUP’s Diane Dodds and Ulster Unionist minister Danny Kennedy are standing in the election for the parties in Northern Ireland.In Wales, Plaid Cymru has four candidates running in the election.The SNP have six candidates in Scotland.The Brexit Party is currently surging ahead, according to the latest poll data from Pollsters, carried out on May , .Farages party was found to come out on top after analysing the results from the past four polls on voting intention.The Brexit Party secured  per cent of the vote compared to Labour on  per cent and the Conservatives on just  per cent.The parties backing a second referendum on EU membership - the Lib Dems, Greens and Change UK - collectively had a share of  per cent.This compared with the  per cent for Ukip and Brexit who are strongly for leaving the EU.Countries in the EU will vote on May ,  with the results expected on May .Change UKConservativesThe Green PartyThe Liberal DemocratsLabourNorthern Ireland PartiesPlaid CymruSNPThe Brexit PartyUkipOur journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: disgraceful behaviour joseph mccann indulged
story: Whether he is innocent or guilty, Joseph McCann is facing  charges which include eight rapessix other sexual offences, four kidnaps, two  imprisonments and a charge of assault.Yet, when the time came for him to face these charges in a preliminary hearing at London’s Westminster Magistrates’ Court last week, he refused to emerge from the cells below and was ed to Belmarsh prison. Chief Magistrate Emma Arbuthnot then tried to get him via video link from jail, but he again refused to participate.In , when -year-old Toronto woman Rehab Dughmosh refused to appear in court on terror-related charges, even liberal old Canada issued an “extremely rare” legal order for the wonderfully phrased “cell extraction”.Five officers were given the authority to,necessary, restrain and drag her to court by the scruff of her neck even , as one court official put it: “It may require shackles on the hands and feet.”Sounds perfectly reasonable to me.So, did -year-old McCann, from Aylesbury, Bucks, get the same treatment  Dream on. Instead, the judge, court clerk and prosecution and defence teams were all forced to up sticks and travel  miles to the prison with, don’t laugh, the official court crest in an Argos carrier bag.There, the judge visited McCann in the healthcare wing, where he refused to confirm his name, wouldn’t stand and, at one point, reportedly turned his back to the impromptu hearing before stating he had “been stitched up”.And it seems he’s not alone in this disgraceful behaviour that’s being indulged by our pathetically weak “justice” system.Last year, Gloucester’s top judge, Jamie Tabor QC, said it has now “become fashionable for defendants to refuse to come to court”, noting that the worrying trend started around two years earlier.Yet as far back as , convicted drug dealer Amir Ali refused to attend a confiscation hearing at Lewes Crown Court in East Sussex because he feared losing his cell to another inmate while he was away and claimed it was a breach of his human rights.At the time, Judge Richard Hayward lashed out at the “barking mad” rules stemming from the  Human Rights Act. He added: “I didn’t know that prisoners could choose whether or not to come to court. I just assumed they would be scooped up by a burly prison warden and dumped in the back of a van.” So did we, Judge. So did we.Yet here we are,  years later, still allowing the human rights of an alleged criminal to run roughshod over the court’s authority.IT’S rumoured that -year-old Grace Jones may be filming a scene with Daniel Craig for the upcoming th Bond movie. Cue much excitement about unleashing the power of the older woman, yada yada.Bring it on. But let’s hope Ms Jones’ character fares better than the last time an “older actress” was announced, amid much fanfare, for the movie Spectre.It was -year-old Monica Bellucciand the scene involved her being groped up against a wall by Daniel Craig, who then left her languishing in a basque and stockings while he went off and fell in love with someone younger.The earth may well have moved for Monica’s character, but ground-breaking it was not.MADELEINE McCANN would have been  on Sunday. Sweet . The age when girls start to blossom into young women, steal our make-up and clothes, have myriad crushes and secrets we might never find out about.Instead, her parents Kate and Gerry have passed another torturous year of not knowing whether she’s dead or alive.Wishing their daughter a happy birthday on their Find Maddie Facebook page, they added: “We love you and we’re waiting for you and we’re never going to give up.”Spending a quiet day at home with their other two children, they reportedly placed presents in Maddie’s room and blew out the candles on a commemorative cake.To not celebrate would perhaps feel like an abandonment of hope. My heart goes out to them and all the other parents of missing children. What they’ve been through – and continue to endure – is unimaginable.THE first rule of “modern friendship”, apparently, is never failing to “like” or comment on a pal’s social media posts.PRINCE CHARLES is advertising for a gardener to tend the herbaceous borders of his house on Scotland’s vast Balmoral Estate.Their skill set should include a love of the outdoors, green fingers and, presumably, the ability to e out of harm’s way should Prince Philip ever choose to drive over for a visit.A GP surgery in Cambridgeshire has hired staff who speak a record  languages to cope with patients born abroad.GENTLEMAN JACK actress Suranne Jones reveals that producers brought in an “intimacy director” to make sure the TV show’s sex scenes “do right by the lesbian community”.Nice workyou can get it. In fact, The Bloke is suddenly considering a change of career.ARE you feeling a bit down   How about a week at a £-a-night retreat set in  acres of tropical gardens on the island of Mustique The Cotton House is run by an old chum of Meghan – now the Duchess of Sussex – and was mentioned on the royal couple’s Instagram account as part of their desire to “shine a light” on those doing “amazing work for mental health”.Hmmm. One of the key factors in being a successful royal is to sympathise with the plight of the less well off proles, or at the very least pretend to.This blatant plug for a friend’s luxury bolthole fails on both counts.LONDON Mayor hopeful Shaun Bailey says university quotas for black students would be ultimately “debilitating” because it would make them feel they didn’t have people’s “respect”.He’s right. I feel the same way about women-only shortlists.Chances are you’ll get what you’re after by being the best candidate.Butyou rule out other potential competitors on the basis of race or gender, you’ll be forever blighted by the whispers of numpties insinuating you got it by social engineering, rather than merit.EVER wonder why some of those pregnant models flogging you maternity clothes don’t look bloated   It’s because many of them aren’t “with child” at all. They’re wearing a fake bump.We already have to tolerate those ads for disability aids that feature a thirtysomething with the agility of a mountain goat simply because companies clearly feel that showing hair loss, wrinkles and bunions is a little too much reality.Now we’re being flogged the illusion thatwe buy certain maternity clothes, we too might swerve the plight of swollen ankles and Popeye arms.Fat chance.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: selena gomez leigh anne pinnock ignore trolls
story: The hugely successful actress and singer has an astonishing MILLION followers on Instagram and is one of the most influential young women on the planet.So when Selena declared this week social media has been “terrible” for her entire generation, we should all take heed. The -year-old has a wise head on those young shoulders.She realises just how toxic s like Twitter, Instagram and Facebook can be and understands the long-term damage they cause.We are already in a very dark place when it comes to these s.This week there was the utterly heartbreaking story of a -year-old girl in Malaysia who took her own le after asking her social media followers whether or not she should do so.Appallingly,  per cent of her Instagram followers voted that she should kill herself. So she did.This young woman, with everything to live for, jumped off a high building in Sarawak, Borneo, and her le was snuffed out. Apparently the poor kid, who has not been named, had a history of depression and was clearly seeking some sort of help or validation via social media.Instead, some seriously sick and callous people encouraged her to die.This is the kind of appalling tragedy Selena is concerned about. She wants people to be more supportive of one another online and to spread kindness instead of cruelty and hatred.Selena has had a tough time of her own battling mental health problems after being struck down by lupus, a disease that attacks the immune system and which forced her to undergo a kidney transplant.She took a long break from Instagram and is now extremely careful about what she posts.Selena has spoken eloquently about the young fans she meets who talk to her about being bullied online and feeling powerless to defend themselves.I am so glad I grew up in a time before my mistakes would be posted for all to see on the internet.I would have been slaughtered on Twitter for my awkward early TV appearances.Instead, I was allowed to learn and improve without being made to feel like a failure.I have recently abandoned Twitter, as it had become exhaustingly toxic.I mostly use Instagram to post funny pictures of my beloved Border Terrier Angus, or details of my outfits on TV, simply because I get so many people asking which shop they come from.I occasionally receive some pretty horrid comments about my sense of style but I try to ignore them and not to be too hurt.This week I spoke to Leigh-Anne Pinnock of Little Mix.All four young women in the group have been bombarded with negative comments online ever since winning The X Factor in .They are vilied for their appearance and choice of clothes — and sadly, Leigh-Anne has been subjected to disgusting racism too.It’s been so tough for her and for bandmates Jesy, Jade and Perrie, leaving them upset and shaken. It has taken years for them to stop looking at social media and be strong enough to ignore corrosive comments.I happen to think some of their outfits are a bit risque and clearly I wouldn’t wear them myself — but so what  It is their choice andthey want to be a bit naughty and raunchy, they should go for it.I heartily applaud Selena and Leigh-Anne for speaking out and trying to limit the power of hideous trolls.We can’t all be like Piers Morgan, who is bombarded with negative and abusive comments but cheerfully retweets them, correcting the spelling and grammar of even the most appalling insults.We are not all so thick-skinned and, as Selena has pointed out, it’s too late to police social media effectively.Sadly it gives the sickest, most twisted and cruellest people a chance to inflict suffering and mental anguish on the rest of us.The message is simple: Be like Selina and Leigh-Anne. Ignore the trolls, don’t feed them — andyou feel you can’t live without social media, try to be positive and uplting.IF you are in need of an injection of sheer joy and happiness, download the  movie musical Calamity Jane and prepare to be enchanted by a le- affirming performance from the late, great Doris Day.At a time in Hollywood when women were either sex symbols or old maids, Doris gave an ass-kicking lead performance to make us laugh and cry, often in the same scene.Doris, who died this week aged , was a triple threat who could act, sing and dance to perfection. She moved with the greatest of ease from musical dramas like Love Me Or Leave Me and Young At Heart to the frothy comedies Pillow Talk and Move Over Darling.A class act who never felt the need to hang on to the spotlight, she was happy as a clam living in Carmel, Calornia, with her beloved pets, raising money to care for neglected animals.Doris will be sadly missed but what a legacy she leaves behind.GREAT to see top actor Stephen Graham finally getting the attention and praise he so richly deserves.He played a blinder in BBC’s Line Of Duty as a tortured undercover cop and is now burning up the screen in The Virtues on Channel  as a broken alcoholic.It’s an acting masterclass, completely believable and utterly authentic.Last weekend, Jodie Comer made a point of praising Stephen during her acceptance speech for the best actress gong at the Baftas.Jodie won for her mesmerising performance as assassin Villanelle in Killing Eve and was quick to say she owes Stephen a pint for all his support when she started acting.So not only an incredible performer but a kind-hearted and generous one too.We will see him on our screens later this year alongside the star of the new Warburtons adverts, Robert De Niro, as well as Al Pacino and Joe Pesci, in Netflix movie The Irishman, directed by Martin Scorsese.I guarantee Stephen will steal every scene he appears in. This is his golden time and no one deserves it more.ABORTION features currently on two of our TV dramas. In Emmerdale, Victoria Barton has been raped and is now pregnant.And in Holby City, it has been revealed that surgeon Ange was raped as a young woman and decided to go ahead with the pregnancy, keeping daughter Chloe.Both fictional characters have the right to choose what to do with their own bodies – something I firmly believe in.Right now in America, that choice has been taken away from real women living in the very conservative state of Alabama, where abortion has been banned altogether.This means a child, young girl or woman who is raped and discovers she is pregnant will have to go through with the birth.Evenshe is the victim of incest and repeatedly raped by a family member – father, brother or uncle – and is impregnated, she will not be able to have a termination.This is hideous, inhumane and deeply disturbing, especially as the draconian abortion ban is likely to spread into other US states.Right here and now in Alabama, doctors who perform abortions could go to prison for  years and the anti-abortion movement is gaining ground.On Thursday, the Republican-led senate in Missouri passed a Bill to ban abortions, this time at eight weeks. Kentucky, Mississippi, Ohio and Georgia have already approved “heartbeat” abortion bans at just six weeks, when most women wouldn’t even realise they are pregnant.Louisiana, South Carolina and Tennessee are set to follow and in other states, legislation is being drawn up to make abortion either more dficult or completely impossible.Aside from some victims of rape and incest, no woman ever goes through with an abortion without suffering horrendous grief and anguish.It’s never a decision taken lightly and we simply cannot go back to the days when pregnant women and the medics who help them are treated like criminals.The US is going backwards at an alarming rate and these laws will simply drive terminations underground, putting women at severe risk of botched backstreet abortions that can maim for le or even kill.Shame on every legislator who helped pass these cruel laws.GOOD luck to Michael Rice, who takes to the stage in Tel Aviv desperately hoping not to come last in the Eurovision Song Contest.This is no reflection on his performance or the song Bigger Than Us, which is our best effort in years.It’s down to biased voting to punish the UK for all the Brexit b*****ks.On the surface, Eurovision is a screechingly hilarious fun-filled campfest to be applauded and enjoyed.But underneath, it’s horribly political and rather grubby.We could have Adele and Robbie Williams singing a duet and still come bottom of the heap, such is the depth of anti-British feeling.Michael wasn’t born the last time the UK won Eurovision, with Love Shine A Light by Katrina  The Waves in .Times have changed since those heady days and now anything other than the dreaded “nul points” will be a victory for young Michael.He’s philosophical about his prospects and determined to enjoy sharing the same stage as Madonna in front of the biggest audience of his career. I wish him well.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. For further details of our complaints policy and to make a complaint please click here.

title: danny baker baby chimp tweet
story: The former BBC Radio  Live presenter seemed to be in high spirits as he was snapped in the front of a car leaving the Hackney Empire theatre in London.He had been performing to fans, the forth gig of his Good Time Charlies Back tour and had been starting his shows by apologising for the Tweet.In the photographs of the evening, the -year-old was seen shaking hands and laughing with fans before getting into a taxi with two female friends.The music journalist sparked widespread fury after he tweeted a black and white photo of an affluent couple holding hands with a chimp dressed in a suit.He had captioned the Tweet, on the day that Archie was welcomed to the world: Royal baby leaves hospital.According to audience members, after walking onto the stage he announced that he needed to: address the elephant in the room.He said: I want to apologise for what happened to me last week in the most appalling circumstances.I did something that on the surface of it looked like the most appalling, crass nonsense.Its entirely my fault and it should have never happened. It castsa pall over events so I genuinely wanted to say thank you for turning up.I hope you know me better than that.Despite his attempt at an apology, the crowd heckled back at the former radio host - who has had  years of experience in the industry.During his show, Danny said: “They said to me last week, ‘Dan, you broke the internet!’ Well, I wish somebody f*****g would.”Police confirmed last week that they had received a complaint about the post.A Met spokeswoman said: “Having reviewed the comments made, we do not consider that a criminal threshold has been met and as such we will be taking no further action.”Baker had quickly removed the tweet - posted to his , followers - and apologised saying: Sorry my gag pic of the little fella in the posh outfit has whipped some up.Never occurred to me because, well, mind not diseased.Soon as those good enough to point out it’s possible connotations got in touch, down it came. And that’s it.His tweet was posted hours after Meghan Markle and Prince Harry showed off little Archie Harrison Mountbatten-Windsor last week.Baker immediately received a backlash from Twitter users branding the post racist due to Meghans heritage - the Duchess of Sussexs estranged dad Thomas Markle is white and mother Doria Ragland is black.But despite his attempts to end the controversy, he was sacked just hours later.Speaking to the Sun Online on the doorstep of his £million London home in pyjama bottoms, he said its not the first time and possibly not the last time he will be sacked for controversy.Blaming an exaggerated Twitter storm, unapologetic Baker said: You see these sorts of things happening to other people and you kill yourself laughing.Its a Twitter storm. The point is theyhave given credence to the vampires by claiming I meant it. It’s rotten.Describing the moment he was told hed lost his Saturday morning radio show, he said: The BBC said they found it abhorrent.I told them f*** you, and f*** off. That’s exactly what I said to them. It wasn’t a very long call.But he later issued a grovelling apology on Twitter, saying he had f***ed up.He bashfully tweeted, saying: Good morning, everyone. Following one of the worst days of my le I just want to formally apologise for the outrage I caused and explain how I got myself into this mess.I chose the wrong photo to illustrate a joke. Disastrously so.I would like once and for all to apologise to every single person who, quite naturally, took the awful connection at face value.I understand that and all of the clamour and opprobrium I have faced since. I am not feeling sorry for myself. I f***ed up. Badly.But the -year-old has landed in hot water more than a few times during his broadcasting career.In , Baker was fired from  Live when station bosses alleged he had incited threatening behaviour in an outburst over a referee.The presenter was claimed to have launched an attack on Mike Reed, the man who was awarded the penalty that clinched the Cha win over Leicester City.His stint with Radio One also ended in being sacked.And in  he attacked the BBC on Twitter and on air after his show was cancelled.In an on-air rant, he described his superiors as “pinhead weasels”.

title: chattering classes praise jeremy kyle working classes derision
story: But equally telling is how much criticism of Kyle’s show has revealed a snobbishness about the people who watched and appeared on it.Tory MP Charles Walker called it “unattractive television”. A columnist at the left-leaning New Statesman magazine described it as curating “a morbidly chaotic picture of a British underclass — for those watching at home to scoff and sneer”.Over at the self-appointed moral compass of Britain, , an editorial complained it preyed on “vulnerable, unhappy people”, turning “a blind eye to mental health problems”. writer Zoe Williams had previously claimed: “Jeremy Kyle has created the cultural spectre of this feral underclass, none of whom has the smallest amount of emotional restraint.”Such bile aimed at a show loved by so many — the final episode, on Friday last week, drew over a million viewers — reveals as much about Kyle as who our commentariat feel has the right to speak, and how they are meant to do it.Kyle’s cull comes at a time of unprecedented openness around personal and mental health issues — as middle-class public figures are lauded for sharing their private woes.Yet working-class people airing their issues on daytime TV find themselves derided.Perhaps Kyle’s guests didn’t speak with the right accent or wear the right clothes. They didn’t have impressive jobs or double-barreled names. They did not articulate themselves calmly, via book deals, or break down on Instragram with full faces of make-up.Rather than be celebrated for bravery, they are written off as dysal.Many of Kyle’s guests did not have mental health issues — they were normal people discussing their problems. There were estranged parents, people struggling to trust or dealing with addiction.Kyle gave real people a voice. Among those who have complained about experiences on the show, many have also said it helped them.Although judgmental about his guests’ actions, Kyle did not judge his guests. Open about his own problems, he believed his guests were as capable of turning their lives around as him. This is more credit than many commentators have given them.It’s offensive to hear Kyle’s adult guests written off as “vulnerable”, asincapable of deciding whether to appear. After  years, , episodes and  series, they would have known Kyle’s style. These were adults choosing to share stories on a  that mattered to them.It comes, of course, as royalty, showbiz celebrities and broadsheet columnists have been praised for publicly airing their personal problems. Never have we celebrated sharing these issues so loudly. When Prince Harry spoke of coming close to a breakdown, singer Will Young his struggle with anxiety and model Cara Delevingne her depression, people applauded.They belong to an industry of openness. Books chronicling personal struggles with mental health are being published to acclaim. Such as Susannah Cahalan’s memoir Brain On Fire, about her psychosis. Or Matt Haig’s memoir about depression, Reasons To Stay Alive. Documentaries such as Bake Off winner Nadiya Hussain’s this week, Anxiety And Me, are praised.Sharing such issues is important. Prince Harry, on his tour of Australia, spoke thoughtfully about how people “must not silently suffer” and must share problems because others “will relish the opportunity to listen or talk themselves”. Yet apparently all this admiration for openness does not extend to Kyle’s guests.Charles Walker complained they were “emotional”. This from a man commended for speaking about his OCD, which he said made him a “practising fruitcake”.Onewriter described Kyle’s guests as “delinquent children, tearaway teens, feckless fathers, long-term unemployed . . . alcoholics, junkies, the sexually insecure, the sexually confused, the sexually poly-amorous” — but could have been describing contributors to the paper’s blog Comment Is Free.District judge Alan Berg described Kyle’s show as “human bear-baiting” and “a morbid and depressing display of dysal people who are in some kind of turmoil”.Asyou couldn’t say the same about many in the House of Commons.The bile for Kyle contrasts, too, with praise of other reality TV — in particular, Love Island. Also aired on ITV, it has seen the suicide of two of its former contestants. Yet the show is celebrated. columnist Leah Green  praised how it “makes the complexities of British society so tangible they can’t be ignored”. Another column in the paper cheered it as “a place where liars and love rats get called out and prejudices are exposed.” It opined: “There is something to be gleaned here about friendship, race . . . and the way men and women communicate.”Perhaps such lessons are just more palatable when they come via men with tanned six-packs and women with perfect teeth.When I watched Kyle’s show I didn’t see a “feral under-class”. I saw people I know. I saw real le, which is messy, dysal and chaotic, which does not always come out in well-formed sentences, memoirs or documentaries made by people with posh accents for Radio .I didn’t watch Kyle to sneer. I watched with relief that some people were truly open about the madness of le. What happens to them now Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: boy 13 never walk again
story: NewsBoy, , will never walk again after back strain was really rare blood clotKyle Burns, , was at football training in Kilmarnock, Scotland, when he got a pain in his backShareCommentsByAmanda Keenan:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY NewsKyle Burns, , was at football training when he got a pain in his back"Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA teenage boy has been left paralysed after suffering from an incredibly rare spinal injury which medics have compared to being shot with a bullet. Kyle Burns, , was at football training when he became unwell and was rushed to Crosshouse Hospital in Kilmarnock. It was thought he had strained his back at Galston Boysapos Club but he collapsed minutes after arriving at AE. Doctors discovered a rare clot on his spinal cord had caused it to rip leaving him with no feeling from the ribs down. The teenager is now facing le in a wheelchair as it is unlikely he will be able to walk again, reports the Daily Record.    Mum Donna, , said: “When doctors told me the news I just ran out the room crying. I couldn’t believe what I was hearing. “Just hours earlier he had been running around playing the sport he lived for and then we were being told Kyle would never walk again.” The promising young player’s injuries were so rare, doctors had to take advice from experts in London before deciding how to proceed. Donna added: “They said the only thing they could compare it to was like someone being shot in the back with a shotgun. “The medical staff said thatKyle had fallen out of a window  storeys high the injuries to his spine wouldn’t have been as severe. “They’ve said they have never had to treat something so bad, that’s how rare it is.”  Doctors diagnosed a fibrocartilaginous embolism, a sudden blocking of an artery which in turn led to a spinal stroke, causing the cord to tear. Medics ruled out surgery and Kyle’s heartbroken family were given the news that there was no treatment to restore his mobility. The tragedy happened last Thursday and the youngster is now facing weeks of gruelling rehabilitation to become strong enough just to use a wheelchair. Donna, from Galston, Ayrshire, added: “I can’t believe this is where we are now. Kyle had come home with his coach complaining of a sore back and walked into accident and emergency. “Within an hour of arriving, he just deteriorated. He collapsed and said to me, ‘Mum, I can’t feel my legs, please help me.’ “The doctors at Crosshouse Hospital couldn’t believe it was the same boy who had come in and he was bluelighted to the spinal ward at the Queen Elizabeth University Hospital in Glasgow.” The Loudoun Academy pupil was rushed for MRI scans, which revealed the devastating extent of his injuries. Donna, who is also mum to Jamie, , Thomas, eight, and four-year-old Cooper, decided to wait a few days before breaking the news to Kyle.  She admits the youngster is struggling to come to terms with his paralysis. She said: “It was a massive shock for me and I thought, ‘How on earth do I tell my -year-old son he’s never going to walk again ’ It’s the most dficult thing I’ve ever had to do. I’m trying to stay strong for Kyle. “I’ve spent the last week in tears, I’m heartbroken for him. He dreamed of becoming a footballer and it feels like he’s been robbed of the le he wanted. “I don’t want him to see me upset because I have to stay positive. It’s just such a horrendous thing for any child to go through. The reality hasn’t hit him yet and I don’t think he will really process the extent of it all until he is in a wheelchair. “At the moment, he’s lying in a hospital bed in the spinal unit and can’t really do much. “He starts rehab on Tuesday and being in a wheelchair for the first time will be a big challenge for Kyle. He just can’t get his head around it.”  Donna, who has been allowed to stay by Kyle’s side at the hospital, says the family are overwhelmed by the support they have received from relatives and friends. They have set up a fundraising drive to buy a state-of-the-art electric wheelchair which they hope will give the teen more independence when he is finally allowed home. Donna added: “Kyle is such a popular lad at school and everyone is getting behind him. “He’s not seen any of his friends yet and I think not being able to run around and do the things he is used to will be very tough.  “His football team have been in contact to offer their support. No one can believe this has happened. “He’s the type of wee boy who gives everything  per cent and he’s always been so active. He loves playing football, basketball and rugby but now it has all been taken away from him. “We want to give him the best wheelchair so that he feels more comfortable. He want’s a white one that he thinks looks really cool. “We also have to look at adapting our home in the future to accommodate Kyle’s needs. I’ve promised him we will do everything we can to make it all happen. “It’s going to be a long road and I want him to be able to le his live to the fullest.”To donate, visit  https:www.gofundme xcncv-kyle

title: holidaymakers panic investors brand thomas
story: NewsHolidaymakers panic as investors brand Thomas Cook stock worthlessHeavy losses in the first six months of  coupled with heavy debts sees British holiday-makers demanding answersShareCommentsByBen Weich:,  MAY NewsFurious customers took to social media as Thomas Cooks financial woes plunged their holiday plans into turmoil "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThomas Cookaposs future was plunged into further turmoil as stock market analysts declared the companyaposs shares worthless. British holiday-makers who have made bookings with the UKaposs oldest travel company were put on alert when the firmaposs value tumbled a further  per cent. In the first six months of , the company has already made operational losses of £. billion, chief executive Peter Fankhauser admitted.Thomas Cook is also labouring under the burden of heavy debts of around £. billion. And the travel giant hit new lows on Friday as analysts at investment bank Citigroup branded their shares worthless , advising they should be marked at zero.  News of the companyaposs problems has caused panic among some of its customers, the Sun reports. On the Thomas Cook Facebook page , one traveller posted: Iaposm flying to Menorca six weeks today. I hope the financial situation will be settled soon.Another said: I just booked for next May to Turkey I really hope youaposre not going into liquidation.A third wrote: Are you going into administration  Because I have a holiday booked in October. Thomas Cook said that all its holidays are ATOL-protected meaning customers will be able to get a refundit collapses. The company has struggled in recent years to keep up with changing habits of customers. Online aggregator sites, such as Chinese-owned Skyscanner, pose a particular challenge. Rather than booking through a sole agent, many holiday-makers can now use such sites to scan the web for the best offers on flights and hotels. The company put their airline business up for sale in February in a bid to raise some much-needed cash.    Auditors Ernst  Young this week said there was material uncertainty around the sale of the firmaposs airline ision. However, while publishing its half-year results, the auditor said that the company, a British household name, should be able to stay afloat considering all the uncertainties it faces. In a tweet, the firm wrote: This announcement has no impact on future holidays or flight only bookings. All our holidays are fully ATOL-protected, so customers can continue to book with confidence.

title: miracle dog swept away river
story: NewsMiracle dog swept away by river and trapped in cave for  hours SURVIVESMitzys owners were convinced they would never see her again after she fell in the River Severn and was swept awayShareCommentsByCath Ascroft:,  MAY NewsMitzy the Shih Tzu "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA tiny dog has miraculously survived being swept down a river and becoming trapped in a cave for  hours. Mitzy the Shih Tzu fell ft from a field into the River Severn when she was out for a walk with her owners Michael and Pat Terleckyi. They were holidaying at Riverside Caravan Park in Brignorth, Shropshire, when the accident happened. The pair from Wednesfield, Wolverhampton, were convinced Mitzy was dead and they would never see her again.    Michael said: We walked the riverbanks for hours and hours and just couldn’t find her. The site warden was looking, along with a number of residents and a huge number of people on social media, but with no luck. We thought we had lost her to the Severn and were advised tohome to Wolverhampton for the night. “Overnight we didn’t get a wink of sleep – we couldn’t help feeling she had surely drowned, but still held on with hope.” But the following day, -year-old Macauley Carpenter heard the faint whimpering of a dog while out walking with his family.    He said: As we left the house we heard a dog crying down by the river so we went and checked it out. “We all saw Mitzy stuck in a cave down by the river so we phoned the fire brigade as soon as we could. “Someone was able to get a canoe onto the river and crawled into the cave to rescue her. “My girlfriend called the owners, who started crying over the phone saying they thought she was a goner – it was a lovely moment.”    Brave rescuers managed to launch a canoe into the fast moving river and get to the terried pooch. Michael said: Everyone involved was very brave to be able to find her and get down to the cave, which was surrounded by overgrowth, and a big thank you to the people of Bridgnorth for your support and giving us hope.”

After sharing photos of herself on Instagram , she has now been snapped up by a leading agency which specialises in models with dferent and distinctive looks.Cheryl plans to juggle modelling gigs for Models of Diversity with her day job as practice manager for a GP surgery.    She said: I couldnapost believe it when they contacted me. My boysand my mum are so proud of me. Now I just want to inspire other people who look dferent - especially women with my condition. Congenital malanocytic naevus has followed Cheryl her entire le. People used to stare at me and refused to sit next to me on a bus. Her le changed dramatically one year as frustrations boiled over while packing for a summer holiday.  She said: I decided that enough was enough and asked myself, how am I going to change this  I ordered a few shorts and decided to wear them on holiday, and I didn’t care what anyone thought. title: six best worst beauty apps
story: NewsSix of the best and worst beauty apps for editing social media selfiesKim Kardashian is thought to use beauty apps to enhance her selfies - but are any actually worth using  Olivia Buxton puts six to the test....ShareCommentsByOlivia Buxton:,  MAY NewsIt is believed Kim K uses apps to edit her social media snaps "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAs Kim Kardashian knows, you don’t have to be ready for your close up to get the perfect photo.Selfie queen Kim is rumoured to use a beauty app called Perfect  to tweak her looks for Instagram .And it is increasingly tempting to run your face through one of the many editing apps out there before presenting it to the world. More than . billion people are on social media and while using filters to blur the edges is the norm, they will not get shot of wrinkles and spots.    So as a -year-old harassed mum of two, I tested six ­beautying apps to seeI could dazzle like Kim. And the results were both stunning and terrying. BeautyPlus This app is free and  million people use it to smooth out selfies. I had to take my photo from inside the app – you can’t import from your camera roll – but it did a very solid job of making me look  years younger.  With the tools, I was even able to thicken my eyebrows. I’ve always wanted a daintier nose and I got one. Plus I plumped up my lips without needing fillers. Just a shame I looked like a cartoon. FaceTune This retouching app is reportedly used by Khloe Kardashian and is meant to serve up model looks.I attempted the small job of smoothing my skin, whitening my teeth, getting rid of my grey hair and, oh, OK then, reshaping my entire face. But I was disappointed. I thought all I needed to do was tap and touch to make quick fixes but my tired, working mum eyes remained. This was the only one I tested that wasn’t free. And at £., I don’t think it’s worth it. Delete, delete, delete. Perfect  This app, on iPhone, Android and Windows, boasts  editing tools to make you look like a star. I turned out more drag queen than beauty queen. I used the contour tool to slim my face, lt my cheekbones and enlarge my eyes. I added some bright eyeshadow and eyeliner. The result  My own daughters screamed. PhotoWonder  Widely considered the secret to a successful selfie, Photowonder is used by more than  million people. I was sucked in by the More ­Beautul tab that made my face slimmer and cleared up my ­blemishes. It can even give you a bigger chest. For fast results, go straight to the One Click tool that smooths out your pores, thins your face and brightens your eyes automatically. I was able to reduce my wrinkles and get sparkling teeth. But I was still more Barbie girl than girl next door. CreamCam  This is supposed to be one of the best apps for giving you perfect skin in a flash but I thought it was a backward step from my original selfie. The retouch tool drained the le out of me. Plus the contour tool gave me a boxer’s nose, when I was aiming for Audrey Hepburn. Facey  Like all the other apps, it sorts out your skin, eliminates wrinkles, and bags under your eyes vanish in a snap. With a few taps I tweaked my face shape and thinned my jawline. But heavy lashes narrowed my eyes and my jaw looked so pointy, I didn’t know who was looking back at me.

title: voice sunday people time end
story: NewsopinionVoice of the Sunday People: Time to end grubby sex for rent tradeA shocking number of landlords are using the current housing crisis by offering young women a place to live in exchange for sexShareCommentsByVoice of the People:,  MAY NewsopinionAt least , young women in the past five years were offered a rent-free place infor sex "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailSex for rent is one of the most disturbing byproducts of the current housing crisis. Landlords are seizing on the desperation of vulnerable youngsters and forcing them into the sordid world of exchanging sex for somewhere to stay. The scale of the problem is incredible. At least , young women in the past five years were offered a rent-free place infor sex. Today we bring you just a selection of some of the disgusting practices of these landords. They make their sordid offers on the listings site Craigslist. And the prospect of a seven-year prison sentence does little to deter them. As the housing crisis deepens this situation will only get worse. We need a sensible approach to tackling this problem. First of all, prospective tenants should be made aware of what to doapproached like this. Is this a police matter  Or local council  Who regulates the private housing sector     This grey area needs to be tightened up immediately. Also crucial is regulating sites like Craigslist. There is a growing danger about the unregulated nature of these listings sites. Of course they are useful for information and offers. But they need to be safe. And that means a layer of protection. The technology exists to automate this process. Simply by recognising some keywords, any advert could be red-flagged and taken down. It would take a small investment – a fraction of the revenue these firms make. Craiglist brought in more than £million last year. Putting aside some of that revenue to protect the vulnerable and end this grubby trade is the right thing to do.
